reviews.review_msg: There is lots of preparation for this class because you need to watch his online lecture videos before going to lecture. During lecture, he goes over questions related to the videos. Best way to study is to make Anki cards while watching the videos and go over the Anki cards regularly. Exams reflect his lecture ppt, videos, and questions.

Uses the flipped-classroom method where in-person lectures were beneficial to preparing for the exams. Is pretty concise and very consistent, exams heavily aligned and is direct to what is taught. Explanations in lecture videos 100% made sense to me because he made it sound so simple. You can tell he is well-experienced in his career and education
Best prof, best teaching method, genuinely good takes pride in his job. And cares about his students.

I took his course bio110 in CC.. all I can say is Onkar is amazing! He boosts you up if you know what you are doing! If any student says Onkar is bad,trust me, it's the student's  fault not Onkar! Onkar, if you see this i just want to tell you that you are the best instructor in CC. Thank you!

Exams are 90% written but they are straight from slides. I only opened my textbook like twice the whole semester. Even if you don't do so great on the exam, there's a lot of room to pick up free marks like labs and assignments which are weighed the same as the midterm.

BEST PROF EVER! Makes such a daunting course  seem so easy! His notes are done beautifully and he tells you exactly what he will test you on for midterms by preparing SLO for each lecture. SO funny and overall such a caring prof, definetly the best prof I have ever had. If you have the option to take a class with him, TAKE IT YOU WONT REGRET IT!!!!

I took BISC 101 with Dr. Bains and he happened to be both my lecturer and my lab instructor. The material was easy to take in because of how well Dr. Bains was able to explain it and made everything so interesting. I wish I had him as my professor for every class.
The best TA I've ever had. Definitely taking another one of his classes again in the future!
Dr. Bains is amazing! He's so social! He can keep up an interesting conversation for so long. I feel he entertains me more than he teachs me. He's also so helpfull when I'm stuck! Thanks bra.

Gotta agree with the posts about Dr. Bains.  He is super helpful, super patient, and super likeable.  He does question students during the lab.  Unlike other profs, he genuinely cares that students understand the material, and will go step by step to make it easier to understand.  Finally, he has a super cute smile :) (had to mention that).
You need to do a lot of self teaching.
Very nice teacher. Funny accent. First few days, you might be cracking up a lot ,but overall a very helpful teacher, nice teacher that actually cares about what she is doing

His part of the final does not cover the most important part of his lectures. It instead emphasizes on graphs and figures students wold usually skip reading because they don't see them as important. Very unreasonable marking scheme making questions worth an unnecessary high amount of marks.

AVOID TAKING CLASS WITH HIM! THIS CLASS WILL MESS UP YOUR GPA IF HE IS YOUR PROFF HE IS THE WORSE PROFF EVER! Punja taught half of the course and you ACTUALLY LEARNED SOMETHING, kennedy was not organized he went all over the place with his notes, said what was GOING to be on the test but instead was very veryhard..overall VERY BAD PROF! tests =HARD

Tells you that his notes and what he says are all you need for the final... this is TRUE HOWEVER.. the things that emphasizes in class aren't even on the final. It was the little insignificant things he spent little time on. His final questions were poorly worded; I has trouble understanding what he wanted from me. KNOW ALL DIAGRAMS!

Not necessary to attend class all he does is pretty much read  his notes which are posted online. Do not study his notes for finals they are not helpful at all. Complete opposite of Zamir Punja who teaches the course with him
Good prof, tries to get students to develop meaningful connections between concepts. Exams a little on the hard side Gives strong hints about the exam with his lecture "hw"

Do not read the txt book for his class, make sure you go over the notes carefully and DO his hw questions. Nice approach to teaching as he doesnt want you to memorize straight facts, but connect general concepts together and apply it to different organisms. Notes can be a bit shallow but his additonal overhead notes are sufficent. Overall very good

His lectures were fine, but the Qs he put on the final were so unreasonable! He picks out tiny details that people r bounded to overlook, and makes them worth like, 2 marks each. Punja is better compared to him. Kennedy is just a crazy cat-lover (yea, 1 Q on the final asked for the name of his cat).

she reads straight off the slides, slides miss information she puts on the final/midterm review and exams are not the same as she tells you to expect does not give a good amount of study material unlike the brown guy who teaches at sfu. shes a nice teacher i would give her a 6/10 no i would not take her again there is just a lot she could do btr

Dr. M made me love bio! She's very passionate, and always willing to help you understand. Lecture slides are full of information and are more than enough to do well on her exams and quizzes. Posts a lot of cool videos to help with the topic. She brought us candy during our midterm, and other snacks on occasion. Would definitely recommend.

Such an amazing caring prof. I've has her for BISC 101 and 102 and I'm surprised she doesn't have a better rating on. BISC 101 itself is a little dull but she does an amazing job of teaching. 102 is about evolution and her grading is tough, but if she wasn't as tough it would be way too easy for a uni class. However labs for 102 are long and boring
I regret taking that class with her. Take it with some other prof else it will be a GPA dropper
Had problems every lecture with the mic. She doesn't speak very loud.

Doctor M's exams are TRICKY! You not only must do your READINGS in the text, but also memorize the material real well and ACCURATELY, very accurately with tiny details. Bc as I said, her exams are tricky, period. Even if you think you know the stuff, you'll get confused by her questions during exams if your not well prepared. Study your labs hard.

Above all Biology teachers, she seems pretty decent enough. It's quite true that she relies more on the textbook than her own notes (not that I've seen them before) but at this case, there might be a lot less to know about the course than usual and just study the textbook. All in all, good teacher.

Megan was a great prof for 101. Her lectures are built around engagement, so showing up and doing the i-Clickers is definitely a must. It can be challenging balancing everything that needs to be done for this course at once, but if you keep up, do work as it comes and really try to understand - (not memorize) - you'll do great with her!

Megan is passionate for biology and cares for her students, however her lecture slides do not cover the majority of what is testable. Lectures are very slow paced and not many concepts are covered within the given time, there are too many group activities and slow I-clicker questions. Instead it is expected to read all of the "weekly readings".

AMAZING LECTURES and her knowledge and excitement for the material made the class even better! I learned so much in her lectures and although the pre readings may seem tedious at times, they really help solidify your understanding of the material we go through in class. Please take her class if you can, it was awesome!
Incredible professor. One of the best professors to have during first year. Always open to talking with students and cared deeply about their wellbeing and success.
Lectures are easy, gives a lot of tips about how to pass his and many other courses. Answers questions very simply.
Bisc101 is a heavy loaded course but Kevin made it seem so easy. He explains topics well and provides lots of practice questions to help prepare for the exams. Very well organized and approachable!

His lectures are very detailed and all written on the slides. He also posts lecture recordings online and his resources are very organized. Gives bonus marks for doing simple quizzes. Very approachable.
So far so good! Kevin is a wonderful prof and a great guy!
Kevin was exactly the person that I was expecting to see in a high-ranking university and He was awesome.

His slides are super detailed and clear. Provides weekly practice exam questions for you to complete and will give you feedback if you ask. He really wants you to do well and cares about your success. I can think of so many ways he went out of his way to help our class. One of the best profs at SFU hands down.
One of the most caring professors. The class was lecture heavy but you can go to him when you are confused about any of the units and he will take the time of day and help you understand.

Kevin is a genuinely good prof. Engages the class and makes difficult material fun to learn about. His tests are hard, but you will do well if you try! He makes you learn how to apply what you're learning, not just memorize facts. Really enjoyed him for the part of semester I had him.
Best prof ever :) very helpful and genuine

So many of the major topics we discussed in lecture weren't on the exam or barely brushed over, while other random topics/one we only briefly touched on seemed to take priority. There were questions that weren't even in the lectures (which is what we're tested on) that were added to the exams. He goes insanely quickly through his slides in lecture.
The main stuff you spent 10 hours studying for? Don't worry it won't be on your midterm or finals, it will be random questions about topics he mention very very briefly.

The midterms were poorly designed, with only written questions and no multiple choice, despite being a biology course. Material taught often doesn't appear on exams. The instructor is dismissive, mocks marks, and offers no flexibility. Lectures are erratic, with disorganized slides. This creates a discouraging experience for first-year students.
Exams are weird and unrelated to lecture. Pretty impatient guy, not a fan.

I went to him for help several times all he did was he critique and mock my grade after the first midterm. Our class average was below 60% which was apparently way higher than the typical averages for this course so do not expect to do well because apparently a 60% is great for a 100 level bio course.
HE IS ACTUALLY THE WORST PROF EVER, VERY UNHELFUL AND DOES NOT KNOW WHAT HE IS TALKING ABOUT. AVOID HIM AT ALL COST

He decided our first midterm mark was too high and decided to make the second midterm so difficult that the class average was below passing. He seemed much happier with the class failing than doing well, but if you do good in your lab you can save your grade. The grading criteria changes depending on Tony's mood and is super unclear.
Chill prof, very nice and passionate about his teachings. Marks fair, but the exams are difficult. Study a lot, read between the lines. Great proff tho
Favorite prof at sfu

You can tell Tony is really interested in the topic, but I found it a bit hard to follow along at times because the lectures are quite boring and repetitive. He doesn't like when you ask a question that he already may have answered before and is quite a tough marker, you actually need to remember every single word on his slides.

There is a lot to cover in biology, what he did in a month was what I learnt in 3 months of high school, so make sure you READ the text book before lecture to make sure things click when your listening to him in class. The test is basically the power points, so make sure you understand. Any  questions ask, he's nice :)

Lecture was all over the place and not interesting at all. Exams are straight out of the notes, but answers need to be word for word. Notes included a lot of pictures. Wouldn't recommend taking bio with him!

He whips through material super fast but all lectures are recorded. Tests are directly from the notes so as long as you memorize them word for word, you'll do well. He tries hard to engage students with biology. He also sends a lot of emails.

Goes over the information extremely fast but the slides provide enough information for you to study off of later on. The textbook is pretty much useless. He seems really nice. Wouldn't recommend him if you're looking for a GPA booster tho.

makes way too many comments on reproduction and things. kind of awkward tbh. exams questions are straightfoward but you need to have very specific details and key terms otherwise you don't get the mark. the labs are pretty fun though
Hes an extremely boring prof, and half his students don't show up after three weeks. However his exams are straight from the lecture slides, so if you dont go to class and study them youll do well.

As long as you memorize his lecture notes you are guaranteed an A in this class. No need to waste your time with the textbook. exam questions for the midterm and final are straight from the lecture slides.
Powerpoint slides are not detailed, textbook provides more information than him. Funny during the lecture though

Terrible notes and basically an overall terrible professor altogether. All of his notes are just pictures with few subheadings from it. You need to read the text or else you are screwed. Don't rely on him, he's useless. Completely and utterly terrible

Lecture notes were vague and too general, textbook use is a must. The final exam overall was relatively easy. Some questions were the exact same questions he gave out on the review sheet. The TA's for bio 101 are a great help =)

I think his class is not that bad. The midterm was not as hard as people are saying it was.Some of the questions were exactly the weekly questions we do every week for tutorial. Maybe people should just stop relying so  much on the prof and actually read their textbook and do some self studying.

Palsson is an incredibly horrible teacher. He is a pathetic excuse of a teacher and shows no genuine interest. He can't present the material at all and he coughs every few seconds. He is incredibly ignorant and allows only 50 min to write a midterm which was terribly hard. He will change your views on bio drastically. Don't take this course at all.

very bad prof, can't understand what he says all the time because he speaks in an alien language. also, he doesn't know what he is teaching about all the time and cannot answer my questions. IMO, he is the definition of a bad professor.

Great prof, a very difficult course 2 teach for anyone, stop being so hard on the man. Coughing didnt bother me at all some ppl will just keep railing on that, dont understand why. read the chapter before coming to class and review the material at his lectures and the tutorials.Point.Blank.PERIOD

so much material. His midterms were long~~~! and his final was hard~~! I think he knew what he was talking about in lectures...but he's too boring he'll put you to sleep. I used to love bio, but now...not anymore.
No Comments
he's a really nice teacher and he tries to communicate with the class, but he has a lung condition! come on, leave him alone guys! its not his fault.
If you get this stupid man as your proff drop the class while you still can.

okay..so he researches slime moulds..i think thats why he coughs so much..he has the mould virus :0!!!hmmm lectured sucked...he tried to make them funny but umm ..it didn't work..i laughed cuz i felt bad...shuda paid more attention to him when he didn't cough tho cuz the final was HARD

This prof is horrible, you can never understand what he's talking about and he never seems to know how to communicate what he's talking about. Plus his exams are really hard. If you liked bio before this class, you won't after.

True, he does cough and what not a lot. But he is a really nice guy and totally willing to help you. There is a lot of material in the course and I guess he just can't talk fast enough and cover all the material that he is supposed to. So he tells you to just do the readings.

He's an easy going guy, but his constant cough and weird noises turn people off of biology.  He knows his stuff, but cannot communicate that well with people so it's very difficult.  Midterm was alrightm, read the text average was 58%

He is the most brutal prof around, near death at any moment.  He has totally turned me off of biology and I can't believe he got this position.  I didn't pay tuitition to meet nice profs but to learn material and be interested. He is brutal.
you guys are mean....he's a nice person even though hes a bad teacher.

dis is aweful!!! being in class equals = listening to unclear english with his oocasional SARS cough and sneeze +  ugly unreadable handwriting.  fav quote from him "i won't go into details, just read the book urself" flashes overhead for 5secs.
lots of material in the course but knows what he's talking about. kind, and endearing! great for a 100-level class.
Problems with spelling
umm....watch out for the sneeze!
FUNNY!  Must have patience
The course has a lot of info to cram into the noggin... too many  wanna be doctors in the course

All you need to do is listen in class, TAKE NOTES which he will provide on the overhead and study them! His way of teaching is simple but that's also the best part of it. His exams are straightforward! You don't have to be a rocket scientist to figure them out, cause they are directly from the notes like "copy and past".

he is one of the best profs at sfu with out a doubt in my mind if you talk with him and ask questions (maybe read a little) you will find the class a lot easier then staying quite and leaving the lab early only to have to read everything when the test comes professor thong is definitively good FTW !!!
Took during summer semester. Class average was too low, and he decided to drop the lower half. Kind of unfair because the class is supposed to be scaled..
His midterm was so easy. His lab midterm was so tricky. His final was so hard. I got A-, but I studied thrice as much as the course that I got A+ from.
The best teacher ive had thus far.  cares for his students, and is very approachable.

Extremely friendly and nice. Soooo helpful and passionate about bio.  For a first year class, extensive amount of work.  Exams really hard.  I studied for 3-4 days, still feel I really knew my stuff, but got a D on the lab exam!  Need to know info INSIDE AND OUT!  MC questions written in a very tricky manner
He's a good lab instructor. He'd often offer to help when he sees u might b having trouble, w/o u even asking. His lab exams r hard tho.
awsome
Good teacher...if you asked, he'd help. And he's good at explaining things.
good prof but hard exams
nicest and most helpful professor. cool name.
cool lab instructor who knew his stuff. also very clear and helpful, way better than the TAs..just wish he taught the lecture this sem.
Good prof, fair exams, challenging though.  Enthusiastic.
DO NOT! miss any of his classes, the lecture tapes are useless. otherwise good prof if u read the text book easy A
No Comments
his notes were helpful and they provided a vital role in doing well on the midterm and final but the TAs were crappy they don't know anything
very good notes easy to follow moderate exam
what can I say?  With a name like Thong you cant go wrong...
His lab notes are so helpful, after studying his lab notes, u dont really have to attend lectures. save time.
No Comments
talks too fast...
ummm dont have much to say didnt go most of the time
